node.title: Anger over super trawler spill of 100,000 dead fish off French coast
node.description: Dutch-owned trawler FV Margiris, the world's second-biggest fishing vessel, shed more thanÂ 100,000 dead fish into the Atlantic Ocean off France, forming a floating carpet of carcasses that environmental campaigners have seen.
node.content:
["Dutch-owned trawler FV Margiris, the world's second-biggest fishing vessel, shed more than\u00a0100,000 dead fish into the Atlantic Ocean off France, forming a floating carpet of carcasses that environmental campaigners have seen.", "The spill, which happened in early on Thursday, local time, was caused by a rupture in the trawler's net, said fishing industry group PFA, which represents the vessel's owner.", "In a statement, the group called the spill a \"very rare occurrence\".", "An environmental group disputed that account, saying it was an illegal discharge of more than\u00a0100,000 unwanted fish.", "The French arm of campaign group Sea Shepherd first published images of the spill, showing the ocean's surface covered by a dense\u00a0layer of blue whiting, a sub-species of cod, used to mass-produce fish fingers, fish oil and meal.", "", "
France's Maritime Minister Annick Girardin described the images of the dead fish as \"shocking\".(Supplied: Sea Shepherd France)
", "Sea Shepherd France said it did not believe the incident was accidental, but rather an attempt by the trawler to discharge a type of fish that it did not want to process, a practice known as \"discharging bycatch\" which is banned under EU fishing rules.", "Lamya Essemlali, head of the campaign group in France, told Reuters she believed the fish were deliberately discharged and is calling for remote cameras\u00a0onboard vessels.", "\"There is total impunity at sea. There is no control, no witnesses and no fines,\" she said.", "\"They owe us transparency because they are exploiting a natural habitat that we all depend on for our survival and the survival of the next generations.\"", "Sea Shepherd France said the spill saw\u00a0more than\u00a0100,000 fish killed.", "France's Maritime Minister, Annick Girardin, called the images of the dead fish \"shocking\" and said she had asked the country's national fishing surveillance authority to launch an investigation into the incident.", "Trawlers such as\u00a0the Margiris use drag nets measuring more than 1\u00a0kilometre in length and process the fish in on-board factories, a practice heavily criticised by environmentalists.", "Following protests by activists, the Margiris was forced to leave Australian waters\u00a0in 2012.", "Traffic data by marinetraffic.com on Friday showed the vessel \u2014\u00a0which is owned by the Dutch company Parleviliet & Van der Plas and sails under the flag of Lithuania \u2014\u00a0was still engaged in fishing activities off France's coast.", "Reuters"]
